item.title: Five New Technologies I Used And Liked In 2018
item.description: 1. Pi-Hole This is my top pick for 2018 for very practical reasons. The Pi-Hole project identifies the domain names of ads from your DNS requests and points them to an un recoverable ip (a black hole). This allows you to have the best ad free experience online available without any configuration of the devices on your local network besides adding it as your own DNS service on the router. There are still ads on domains that serve their own ads (google, facebook, etc.

item.title: An overview of public transit feeds around the world
item.description: The gtfs and gtfs-realtime are the modern standards for sharing public transit scheduled data and current updates to routes. The embedded script will tell you what is currently publicly shared (transitfeeds.com) and what is currently being published to google. As of the writing of this script, there are 96 different realtime feeds from a handful of agencies around the world that publish an updated, and available publicly.
